page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT TRENDS
page.content: In 1885 the parish of Penpont had 53 men employed in rural craft industries such as blacksmithing and dry stone dyking. Until 1970 Kirkpatrick's of Thornhill ran a bacon and sausage factory which distributed goods throughout Scotland. Now there is hardly any manufacturing industry left in the area and most people find employment in service industries. Many others must commute to work in Dumfries where ICI maintains a large chemical works; UNIROYAL have a rubber factory, and several industrial estates have attracted a variety of smaller industries. Service jobs have also been lost to the area. Penpont's shops have fallen from 12 last century to only 3 now and the area is littered with closed rural churches, post offices and schools.
